intro: Potentilla kleiniana, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided into five leaflets, giving it a distinctive appearance. Potentilla kleiniana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
